ygData.subject: RE: Bard Superstitions?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmm so you trade the AC for the specic fire/cold magic resists? I was playing Guardian for the AC party buff and Largos for the AC mob debuff - even when we
ygData.messageBody:
Hmm so you trade the AC for the specic fire/cold magic resists?

I was playing Guardian for the AC party buff and Largos for the AC mob
debuff - even when we were fighting non-casters. But vs casters I can see
you'd want more protection from their damage type. My party was all lower
than me at 22 - mics tanks and the odd druid or cleric. The mobs were
green, blue and occasional yeller cons to me so I figured they needed all
the damage resist they could get.

Sylly.

-----Original Message-----
From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Friday, September 03, 1999 1:55 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Bard Superstitions?

From: <kim@...>

On Fri, 3 Sep 1999, Abraham Hardjana wrote:
>
> Dry bone:
> Hymn + Elemental Rhythms + Anthem
>
> Hag:
> Hymn + Guardian Rhythms + Anthem

Elemental and Guardian Rhythms (and Purifying Rhythms)
increase your magic resist by the *same* amount. The only
advantage of Guardian Rhythms is that it has a slightly
better
AC buff, and that it stacks with the other Rhythm songs.
Elemental Rhythms increases your fire and cold resist as
well
as magic resist.

So if you're only playing one Rhythm song, it should be
Elemental. Use Guardian if you're playing two.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
